intro: Psychotria tahanica, commonly known as the Tahanica Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Psychotria tahanica is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
